problem.markdown:
>>100 Joules of coal enter a power plant and 35 Joules of electricity are generated. This relationship most directly demonstrates that:<<
() energy is created in the conversion (x) energy loses the ability to do work when it changes form () energy is destroyed in conversion () coal is a higher density energy source than electricity
[explanation] The 1st Law of Thermodynamics states that energy is neither created nor destroyed. However, the 2nd Law of Thermodynamics states that when energy changes form, or when it is used to produce work, some energy is always lost as heat. [explanation]
